discourse_list.title: FakerDao; a potential risk to Maker Governance?

content.content: ScopeLift    FakerDAO: An Exploration Of MakerDAO’s Governance Incentives — ScopeLift The MakerDAO project is one of the most interesting experiments in the crypto space. It pushes boundaries along multiple dimensions. Perhaps the most overlooked aspect of the project, at least until recently, is its governance.      Just saw this posted. They’ve open sourced their code and are inviting discussion on their reddit post here: https://www.reddit.com/r/MakerDAO/comments/fh3s8d/fakerdao_an_exploration_of_makerdaos_governance/ In brief, they’ve made a contract that would allow a person to lend their MKR to someone else for a fee to vote in MKR governance. Making governance attacks easier, it would seem.
content.GPT-summary: The post discusses a potential risk to Maker Governance posed by a new contract called FakerDao. The author of the post explains the contract and its implications, while also inviting discussion on the topic. The post also includes constructive criticism of the proposal and raises questions about its potential impact.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
